name: unpropitious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not likely to be successful, or not showing any signs of success: It may have seemed an unpropitious time for a general election. She assumed power in distinctly unpropitious circumstances, facing union unrest, and a failing economy. Opposite
propitious
More examplesFewer examplesEven beyond the question of funding, the climate for educational innovation seemed unpropitious. The letter could not have arrived at a more unpropitious moment. Owing to the extremely unpropitious weather, some of the plants did not flower.
